title: Ticket #1380: Connections to negotiator fail if NEGOTIATOR_HOST is specified
description: After upgrading the BatLab pool from v7.0.1 to v7.4.1 the Condor accounting scripts stopped working. A recent condor-users thread explains the problem. Search for subject "COLLECTOR address or hostname not specified in config file" in the condor-users archive (click here)
remarks:
2010-May-05 11:38:34 by danb:
I believe this problem is caused by [15569], which also breaks COLLECTOR_HOST as used by startd hibernation. That commit appears to cause <SUBSYS>_HOST to be mishandled if none of the entries listed in the value of <SUBSYS>_HOST match the local hostname.
attachments:
• subsys_host_fix.patch 25027 bytes added by rrati on 2010-May-25 15:13:16 UTC.
    Corrects handling of possible multiple entries of COLLECTOR_HOST by pushing the intelligence for the "correct" entry our to the tools. This patch also changes the way condor_restart/reconfig will work. If the user issues condor_restart -subsystem collector, it will send a restart to ALL collectors in COLLECTOR_HOST
check_ins: 2010-Jun-02 14:07   Check-in [18295]: Fixed handling of multiple entires in COLLECTOR_HOST. The previous logic attempted to be smart in determining which entry to use if more than one entry existed for COLLECTOR_HOST.
